Posts.Content: So Sorry for your loss and I want to thank you for sharing the information to help others. Becky
Posts.Title: Spindle Cell Metaplastic Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: I want to tell you how sorry I am for the loss of your mother and I know how painful that loss is. I think that you are amazing to put yourself out there and offer help after your recent pain. I was diagnosed with breast cancer in 9/05 and have had 8 rounds chemo after partial mastectomy and now facing 7 weeks rads. I am so anxious about mets as I have extensive lymphatic invasion(lymphangitic carcinomatosis per path ) which noone seems to be able to tell me anything reassuring other than not to worry until something shows up. I have been dizzy and unable to sleep well for the past 2 weeks and am told it is probably anxiety. Thanks for any input Becky
Posts.Title: Carcinomatous Menigitis

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed in 12/05 with a 2cm tumor 2 lumpectomy and a partial mastecomy. I had a complete hysterectomy 1/06 due to disfuntional bleeding and a ca 125 of 77. Cancer is lobular and ductal invasive with extenxive lymphatic invasion positive er/pr, HER neg. My sister was diagnosed 12 weeks after me and has already had a single mastecomy. I am very concerned with the lymphatic invasion and have very large breasts which they say makes it more difficult to diagnose. I have had 8 cycles chemo 4 a/c and 4 taxotere. Tried Taxol but had severe reaction. I am allergic to the dye for MRI and CT scan. I went for my first of 35 treatments with radiation and decided that I can not live with what ifs and asked to see a surgeon to have bilateral mastectomy. I have been asking this for this from day one and my oncologist just says NO. I do not want to be in the conservation study as I have encountered more people with mets than I can believe. Does anyone have any experience or knowledge that could add to this. Thanks for any help
Posts.Title: "elective Bilateral" Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for your reply. I too have thought the same thing and have not asked. I am going to the platic surgeon tomm to set up the suregery. I need to have a needle biopsy under the right arm this time for a new lump and then biopsy on a lump in my leg. This just makes me more sure now than ever to get this surgery done. thanks again Becky
Posts.Title: "elective Bilateral" Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Deb I so aprreciated reading you message. I feel they same way that once it is done I will feel so much better. My surgery has been rescheduled once again for the 6th of october. They are also doing bilateral sent. nodes and a biopsy of my leg. I have since developed red pathces on the right breast (left is the cancer). I am trying not to get too nervous about this new development and feel that is is just another sign that I am doing the right thing. I am so glad to hear that is was not too painful. I tend to tollerate pain well. I will post as soon as possible after surgery. I love this message board and the people are so wonderful! Thanks again Beck
Posts.Title: "elective Bilateral" Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for writing. I have been trying to follow my gut from the start. I now have a date for the surgery for next week and feel that this is the best way to proceed. My 0oncologist that has ben against this from day one is a female. I feel that she is really wanting to add me to the statistics for breast conservation but I on the other hand want to be free from cancer. t was explained to me that the survival rate is unchanged in breast conservation but the recurrence rate is not. I do not want to spend every other year in treatment if I can get throught the mastectomy and be disease free. I do not want the surgery and am not ready but I would rather know that I have a substantally reduced risk of recurrence. Your note validates my feelings even more which as you know is a god thing when faced with such a huge descision. Thanks again Beck
Posts.Title: "elective Bilateral" Mastectomy

Posts.Content: I am not sure by your message what they are seeing on the exam. I would see a Breast surgeon and get some input now. The only "true way" to rule out cancer is by tissue sampling. I personaly had a suspicious mass 2 years ago that was later said to be nothing. I am now in the midst of invasive lobular and ductal carcinoma that has extensively invaded the lymphatic system. No radiology is 100%. I hope this helps without scaring you too much but better be safe than too late. Becky
Posts.Title: Mri Every 6 Months

Posts.Content: I was scheduled to have the bi lat mastectomy when I went for an ultrasound of the axila. TO my surprise the large palpable mass that I fealt was not the concern the tech found 3 3 centemeter tumors. She brought in the radiologist who collected 3 fine needle aspirations. She said I have a 50/50 benign or malignant. These findings are on the oppsoite side of my original tumor that was 2 cm in the left breast. I have a feeling that they already know that they are malignant but I have waited the 2 days that was indicated for test results and they say the report is not ready yet. Now I have to wait through the weekend to find out. This is so frustrating and I need to vent. As we all know the waiting game is so hard. The radiologist mentioned that additional chemo may be needed post mastectomy which I process in my racing imagination as malignant results. Any comments or thoghts or experiences welcme. THanks Beck
Posts.Title: 3 New Tumors

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your message. I keep a positive attitude for most of the time. I try to teach my kids not to give up on anything so what example would I be if I did. I have the hardest time when I am in limbo. The one tumor biopsy preliminary result shows no malignancy so now I just have to wait for the excisional on that and the other 3. Thanks again. Beck
Posts.Title: 3 New Tumors

Posts.Content: The initial reoprt looks good so far but because the tumor capsulated they still need to do and excisional biopsy. They did say no malignant cells seen. I will take the good news for now and try not to overthink it. They are calling today with the surgery date. They are going to do Bi lat mastectomy and multiple lumpectomy for right axilla and leg all at once. Thanks so much for asking. How are you doing? Becky
Posts.Title: 3 New Tumors

Posts.Content: I think it took about a half hour for the node removal but the process takes a couple because the dye gets injected I think 2 hours befor the surgery. Actually the sound is neat when they run the gieger counter over the node. Let me know how you make out. I am going to plastic surgeon tomm to set up my bilateral mastectomy. Keep in touch Becky
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: hi there, first I want to say sorry you are going through this. When I had mine done I was aware of the stinging from the lidocaine, so I decided that just getting the injection for the dye would be better than enduring the lidocain. For me it wasn't that bad at all although I had the same fear that you have now. I did ask for something for the anxiety. My Best to you! Becky
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Thanks for writing. I am doing okay. Surgery is set for 10/6. I am having repeat sent node on both sides due to 3 new lumps being located durring ultrasound. The fine needele biopsy said No Malignant cells but the tumor of 3 cm was incapsulated so they say the excision is needed. They are also going to biopsy a spot on my leg. How are you doing? Becky
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Just read your message and was so glad to hear it went well. Keep me posted, you are in my thoughts. Becky
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: Thanks for writing. I am doing okay. Surgery is set for 10/6. I am having repeat sent node on both sides due to 3 new lumps being located durring ultrasound. The fine needele biopsy said No Malignant cells but the tumor of 3 cm was incapsulated so they say the excision is needed. They are also going to biopsy a spot on my leg. How are you doing? Becky
Posts.Title: Help...scared of Pain During Radioactive Dye Injections

Posts.Content: I was very touched my your question. I have a daughter who is 22. I think for me the best thing that she can do is be happy and be okay. She just started nursing school and my hope is for her to do well and not be held back my health issues. I am so sorry to hear about your sister how sad and scary. On the practical side things that you can physically do, I know that when I was in chemo and even now I don't always have the energy to do all the houswork I want and need to. Maybe a cleaning day, a trip to the movies or just a encourage her to go out for a short walk with you. A little comfort time goes a long way. You sound like a very loving daughter. Beck
Posts.Title: i Love my Mom

Posts.Content: I can understand not wanting to go to a family doc first however most diagnostic testing has to be ordered by a doc. I do not know of any testing facility that will test without an order. I would check the local hospital for a referral to a breast center or ask if they can recomend something for you. In MA we have the womens health network that will help even moderate income families attain screening and diagnostic testing. I think that is federally funded so they may have something along those lines. Do not wait! I waited 3 months because I did not havde insurance and it is not a good thing to do. Hopefully it will turn out to be a clogged mammary or something but better to be safe. Good luck Beck
Posts.Title: Can't Seem to Get Help Getting a Mammogram
